value.0: You did it, <lad/lass>! The gates to the Market District are now open, and we may turn out attention to evacuating the Imperial citizens.

<StartAction>[Anagril seems disappointed by your words.]</Start> At a time like this, all you can think of is yourself? You should be ashamed, <FirstName>. Still, I suppose we're all under a great deal of stress...
I suggest you follow the citizens in retreat to the Market District. I will remain here to ensure all who can escape do so, but I will follow suit as soon as I possibly can.
Yes, of course. Please, do not allow me to interfere with your self-preservation, <FirstName>. Farewell, and good luck.

I can't, <FirstName>. My duty demands I save as many lives as possible, and we still do not know who may be trapped within the wreckage here. Find yourself a place of refuge, and do not worry over my fate any further.
<StartAction>[Captain Anagril salutes you, his eyes grim, but a small smile upon his face.]</Start> Good luck, <FirstName>, and may Rakha keep you from harm.
Your father would have been as proud of you as I am, <FirstName>. You honor his memory with your deeds.
<StartAction>[The Captain's expression darkens visibly.]</Start> Your father was a great man, <FirstName>, both as a leader, and a friend. He deserves to be respected, regardless of how you may feel.
But since you seem to care about little other than yourself, perhaps you should go find a place of refuge from this attack.
Do not harbor old grudges against him, <FirstName>. Your father cared deeply about you, whether he was able to show it or not...
It sounds to me as though you are still coping with his death, <FirstName>. In time, I'm sure the pain will ease, and you'll remember the good times you did spend with one another.
For now, though, you need to get to safety. Above all else, I am sure your father would have wanted you out of harm's way.
<StartAction>[Captain Anagril places his hand on your shoulder comfortingly.]</Start> His loss was a great blow to us all, <FirstName>, but I see his strength in you, and that gives me hope...
But it is unwise for you to stay here any longer. You have done enough to aid the people here, and I'm sure your father would not want your life endangered.

If by either strength or stealth we can enter the Grand Hall, we may be able regain mastery of the Control Stone. It will likely prove quite difficult, but I believe that is our only chance of escaping this trap.
If you wish, I can lead an attack on the gates, in the attempt to buy you some time. With luck, the enemy will be distracted long enough to allow you ample opportunity to enter the Grand Hall.
The enemy outnumber us considerably, and a direct assault will be dangerous. It might be wisest to try and discover a safer route into the Grand Hall. Either way, I offer my aid to you.
Since Magistrate Okaris is now gone, my sword is at your command, <FirstName>. What do wish me to do?
As you wish, m'<lord/lady>.
I have heard rumors that a secret passage was constructed beneath the Grand Hall, but I do not have knowledge of where its entrances may lie. Your father was likely the only one who knew for sure...
You may wish to visit the Imperial Academy, and speak with the survivors in hiding there. Perhaps one of them will be able to give assistance.
Two strangers were trapped within the Imperial District along with us, and lent their aid in ensuring our people escaped to the Academy safely.

One of them went after the enemy into the Grand Hall, but his companion remains at the Imperial Academy. I do not know the identities of these men, but they seem to be our allies. Perhaps they can assist us in our task.
Very well, <FirstName>. May Rakha guide you and keep you safe.
My men and I will do all we can to assist you. Come, my soldiers! We go to fight the enemy!

These fanatical barbarians entered the Market District a short while ago, no doubt being granted access by the sorcerers in the Grand Hall. They quickly took to slaughtering all who stood in their path.
Time is growing short. The enemy seems to have retreated to the Grand Hall for now, but should they return, I do not have the strength to stand against them...
The Control Stone is our only hope of escape. While it is still in the hands of our enemy, we cannot lower the seal around the district gates, trapped within our own walls...

<StartAction>[Anagril gives you a disapproving frown.]</Start> While that magical seal is still in place, you are trapped here as well as us, <FirstName>. So I would say this concerns you a great deal...

<StartAction>[Anagril gazes around at the many lifeless bodies within the district, his face full of sorrow.]</Start> Many have died, <FirstName>, defenseless against the cruel slaughter our enemy has wrought upon us.
I have placed those who survived in the Imperial Academy for now. Until the district gates can be opened, I believe it will prove the safest haven for our people.

I wish I knew, <FirstName>. The enemy is led by a fearsome fellow, garbed in red robing. He seems to be a sorcerer of great power, for he destroyed the courtyard gates with little more than a wave of his hand...
Whomever this man is, he seems intent on the Grand Hall. The heaviest fighting has occurred there, and to my knowledge, he remains inside.
We must find a way into the Grand Hall. If Harkon remains trapped within its walls, his life is in great peril. Even he does not have the strength to stand against the Crimson Prophet alone...
I don't like the sound of this. We must discover what purpose the Prophet has in the Grand Hall, and do what we can to put a stop to it!
Your description of this man sounds very similar to the Crimson Prophet. If he is leading the assault, then we are indeed in great peril.
The Crimson Prophet... It must be him. If he is leading this attack, then you cannot imagine the danger we are in...
If we can regain mastery over the Control Stone, or somehow destroy it, we should be able to lower the seal on the gates.
<FirstName>, you're alive! Thank the gods! I received word of a great explosion at the Imperial Estate, but I'm afraid we have only now had the opportunity to come investigate...
Tell me, though, where is Magistrate Okaris? Why is your father not in your company?
<StartAction>[The Captain's shoulders slump visibly.]</Start> The... the Magistrate is dead?! This only makes matters worse... I fear Ghaarak may be seeing its darkest hour.

<FirstName>, disaster has fallen upon our city. I... I should have seen the warning signs, but it has been so peaceful here of late... I suppose my instincts are not what they used to be. Now, I fear all of Ghaarak may suffer for it.

It began with a group of men arriving at the Grand Hall, claiming to be visiting sorcerers from the south. I thought they seemed a bit unusual, but I have little understanding of the arcane, and Zhiram believed their words.
A short while later, I received word from Officer Ganolin that strange ships were seen just off the docks, and he was concerned they may prove hostile.
I ordered most of my soldiers to the Market District in case his worries held any merit, a mistake I would soon regret. It seems we have been victim to a rather clever assault upon our city.
As soon as my forces were depleted, the sorcerers murdered Zhiram and took possession of the Control Stone. I took what men I had, and tried to fight them, but I'm afraid we were driven back.
They have used the Control Stone to seal off the gates to the Market District, cutting me off from my men, and trapping us, along with the Imperial citizens, in this district.
I fear we are all in great danger, for now our forces are divided, and we have no escape from the Imperial District. If nothing is done, we may find ourselves doomed...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_1_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>
<StartAction>[Captain Anagril appears quite concerned over the events which have transpired in the Grand Hall today.]</Start>

So Varhun has betrayed the Empire... I will confess the Chancellor was not the easiest chap to get along with, but he always seemed very devoted to Sharakha. I wonder if we'll ever know his purpose now...

I have placed my men on high alert, and it might be best if you warn your father to be wary for a bit longer, just in case Varhun has set any trouble into motion. I'd suggest going to the Magistrate as soon as possible.
Please hurry to Okaris, <FirstName>. It would be a terrible tragedy if something were to happen to the Magistrate...

<StartAction>[Captain Anagril, the grizzled old leader of Ghaarak's garrison, beams at your approach.]</Start> I hope this <quarterday> finds you well, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. Tell me, what may I do for you today?
Varhun may be a difficult man, <FirstName>, but he has proven loyal to the Sharakhan Empire many times over. I think you are simply jumping to conclusions, <lad/lass>.
Now, is there anything else I can do for you?

Do you insist on believing everything you read, child? Mikel is a known forger and a fake. Given the tenacity with which you're clinging to this issue, I'm beginning to wonder whose payroll Mikel's really on: the Chancellor's? Or yours...

Let the matter rest, <FirstName>, for I'm beginning to understand how you try your father's patience so. Now please... other than this childish game you insist on playing, is there anything else I can assist you with?
I shall give you the honors of bringing this charge upon Varhun, <FirstName>. Please, speak with the Chancellor and inform him he is under arrest for treason against the Empire.
So, have you found anything out of the ordinary in Chancellor Varhun's possession?
I hope you're certain about this, <FirstName>. Otherwise, this is going to prove quite the scandal. Keep searching, and let's see what you come up with...

<StartAction>[Captain Anagril frowns, his expression troubled.]</Start> I'm afraid that's not much in the way of evidence, <FirstName>. We're just going to have to assume the Chancellor is innocent of these charges...
That is due to the fact that I AM innocent, Captain! Now, I want both of you gone from my chambers at once! If you're lucky, I'll consider letting this slide...
I'm sorry for having disturbed you, Chancellor. Come along, <FirstName>. I think enough damage has been done here for one day...
<StartAction>[Anagril takes the letter from you, reading over the incriminating words.]</Start> Well now, this is quite damning proof of Varhun's guilt.

<StartAction>[Captain Anagril, the grizzled old leader of Ghaarak's garrison, beams at your approach.]</Start> I hope this <quarterday> finds you well, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. Tell me, what may I do for you today?
As you wish, <Sir/Madam> <FullName>. Should you need anything, don't hesitate to ask.
Your father has returned to the Imperial Estate, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. You should go there if you wish to speak with him.

Your father seems to have drawn near to the end of his meeting, and has asked that you come to the Council Chamber with all haste. He didn't mention what matter it regarded, but he seemed very distraught.
I am just relaying the message, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. He claimed it was quite urgent, though, so perhaps you should do as he asks.
Good <quarterday> to you, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>.

Currently, your father is in important counsel with envoys from Emperor Rakha. They've been in discussion for quite some time, so I'm not sure when he'll be available. Rest assured, I'm sure he'll send for you as soon as he can.

Ah, I had completely forgotten that was today. Congratulations on your achievement, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>, and I'm sure it must have been an important visit for your father to have missed it. He's quite proud of you, after all.

That doesn't mean he doesn't care. It's just that Magistrate <LastName> has quite a bit on his mind at the moment. There's talk of war brewing in the north, and he's doing all he can to ensure it doesn't reach us.
He'll come around, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. Just give him some time to settle matters of duty. Be patient, and I'm sure it will all work out fine.
Please do. Your father is a great man, one that I would follow into any battle. It has always pained me to see such a rift come between you two.

Any time, <lad/lass>. I shall pray for Rakha to keep you safe, and guide you with his graceful hand. Fare thee well, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>, and should you need anything else, do not hesitate to ask.

Yes, I'm sure Magistrate Okaris did, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>, and that suggests that his important counsel is indeed nearing its end. If you are unwilling to wait patiently for him here, I will inform your father that he'll find you pacing the inner halls.

As true as that may be, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>, your father knows that the Emperor's words must be heeded, come life, death, or the end of time... I will convey your urgency to him but it is not my place to force his hand.
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PRELUDE" >>

You know the markets aren't safe, <FirstName>. There've already been twelve murders there since winter... Perhaps it's time I talked to your father and Officer Ganolin about assigning you a bodyguard. In the meantime, stay out of trouble, all right?

Mikel? Don't be ridiculous! These walls shall always protect you, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>, mark my honor. As for goodman Ravenclaw, have you spoken with Officer Ganolin in the Market District? If something truly is afoot, I must not leave my watch.
<StartAction>[Anagril's expression turns grim.]</Start> That is a very serious accusation, <FirstName>, and one that I have trouble believing, even of Varhun...
<StartAction>[Anagril frowns at you.]</Start> Well, a "hunch" isn't enough reason for me to act upon such a grave matter, <lad/lass>.
Varhun is a high ranking official within the Imperial ranks. If I were to go accusing him of treachery with such insubstantial evidence, I could find my own position threatened.

If you can find further proof, then perhaps I can help you. Until then, I have to say that I think you are mistaken as to Varhun's nature. He may be a bit tough to take at times, but I can't imagine he would plot against the Magistrate.
Good <quarterday> to you, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>, and farewell.
Mikel Ravenclaw is little more than a roguish thug. I wouldn't put it past him to lie about a matter like this, if he stood to gain from it.
It's no bother, <FirstName>, but I simply cannot accuse the Chancellor of such a vile act without some sort of evidence. I hope you can understand...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm sorry, <FirstName>, but you just don't have any evidence worthy of supporting your claim. I'm afraid there is little I can do to help you in this matter.
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> Well, I guess this matter is serious enough to warrant an investigation...

Let me take a look at that... <StartAction>[Captain Anagril glances over the letter quickly.]</Start> This looks to be Varhun's handwriting! ...And the content is... most alarming... Still, Mikel's been known to dabble in forgeries in the past.
Let's go have a talk with Varhun, shall we? Perhaps we can get to the bottom of this matter...
<StartAction>[Anagril takes the letter from you, reading over the incriminating words.]</Start> Well now, this is quite damning proof of Varhun's guilt.
Come, <FirstName>. We shall have to confront Varhun on this matter. <StartAction>[Anagril motions for you to follow him.]</Start>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
Let me pass so I can get out of this trap!
Out of my way then, fool!
Why not come with us, Captain...
May the gods watch over you, then, Captain.
Very well, Captain.
I'm glad I could help, Captain.
He's dead to me and good riddance, I say!
He's dead. Why waste thoughts on him now?
Well, I'm glad the fool is dead!
Perhaps... but I still have my doubts on that.
I... I still can't believe he's dead...
Continue on your business, Captain.
Is there any way into the Grand Hall?
Is there anyone else who may aid us?
I'll scout ahead. Wait here for my return.
Lead an attack on the Grand Hall.
Your failures are no concern of mine, Captain!
Are the citizens safe?
Why have these invaders assaulted Ghaarak?
We must regain power over the Control Stone.
My fool of a father went and got himself killed.
My father's dead. The blast you heard claimed his life.
He... he is dead, Captain...
I'll do that.
Varhun is plotting against my father.
I found this letter in Mikel Ravenclaw's possession.
No, not yet.
I found only a letter's charred remains.
This letter clearly proves Varhun's guilt.
See you around, Captain.
I wish to speak with my father. Where is he?
I've been distraught all day! Did he come to me?
Very well, Captain. I shall go meet with him.
I don't feel like talking anymore...
He didn't even come to my citizenship today.
He sure has a strange way of showing it...
I'm his only child! All I ask is a moment of his day!
I suppose you're right, Captain.
Thanks, Captain. It's nice talking to you.
But he summoned me here!
It's a matter of life and death, Captain!
Someone tried to kill me in the Market District!
Mikel Ravenclaw's trying to have me killed.
Chancellor Varhun aims to kill my father.
It's just a hunch...
Very well, then. I'll return with further proof.
Mikel Ravenclaw was hired by Varhun to kill me.
I suppose you're right, Captain.
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Captain, my father's life is in danger!
I found this letter in Mikel Ravenclaw's possession...
I found this letter in Varhun's chambers...
